item.title: A Bangladesh Air Force training jet crashes into a Dhaka school, killing at least 19
item.description: The jet crashed into a school campus in the capital, Dhaka, shortly after takeoff on Monday.

item.title: A creek with atomic waste from WWII is linked to increased cancer risk
item.description: A new study in JAMA shows how proximity to Coldwater Creek, where nuclear waste from the Manhattan Project was improperly stored, affected cancer rate...

item.title: Assad is gone. But can Syrians go home?
item.description: After over a decade in exile, many Syrians living abroad are contemplating what was once unthinkable: going home. But what does home look like today?

item.title: COMIC: Exploring the ocean's wonderous, mysterious depths
item.description: Did you know that we know less about the sea than we do about space? With this comic, we explore some of what scientists do know about Earth's ocean.

item.title: The world keeps millions of vaccines on ice. Is it worth it?
item.description: It costs nearly $100 million a year to maintain global stockpiles of vaccines for Ebola, cholera, meningitis and yellow fever in case of emergency. A ...
